intro: Boechera paupercula, commonly known as the poorleaf rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, toothed leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is often covered in a fine layer of trichomes, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. Boechera paupercula is also noted for its genetic diversity and is sometimes used in studies related to plant evolution and adaptation.
